definition: lit. briefcase company/dummy corporation/shell company/fly-by-night company
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)

sentences.english: This paper company does fictitious transactions exclusively.
sentences.chinese: 這個皮包公司專做買空賣空的生意。

sentences.english: Don't believe any fly-by-night company, they all lack credibility.
sentences.chinese: 皮包公司的信譽值得我們相信嗎？

sentences.english: After getting at the officials in charge, a shell company was finally awarded the highway contract.
sentences.chinese: 勾兌了負責官員後皮包公司終於拿到了高速公路合同。

sentences.english: Can we believe in the credibility of fly-by-night companies?
sentences.chinese: 皮包公司的信譽值得我們相信嗎？

definition: lit. to hang a sheep's head while selling dog meat (idiom)/fig. to cheat/dishonest advertising/wicked deeds carried out under banner of virtue
pinyin: gua4 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4

definition: to be affiliated with/to operate under the wing of/affiliation
to speculate/to play the market/(fig.) to sell hot air/to swindle people by posing as a reputable operator
a swindle/a trap/a racket/a scam/CL:場|场[chang3]
private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
